Posts.Content: Like the other have said...congrats to you and toloh... I don't drop by as often as I should...sorry for not giving the kind of support I have received! But any way I was told by a co-worker that her husband had been diagnosed. She said her husband grabbed the first guy in the phone book. I don't tell co-workers about my diagnoses but I did tell her about my "friend"...took some talking but I finally got her to go my doctor yesterday...she had told me his surgery was for next monday...well guess what after she and her husband talked to him...his surgery is now Dec 1st...she was soooo happy I told her about my "friend". Posts.Title: Sex and PC

Posts.Content: Nerve Bundles: The Dr. said he saved the right side, but I can't recall what he said about how much of the left side he removed. So my age and bundles remaining are right with most of you guys! I truly believe the bulk of my recovery is coming from my regular stimulation down there. That's really the point I'm trying to make. If you read through some of the posts on that web site you see many people having the same issues we are but they still have all their body parts intact. The exercises they tell them they need could help most all the guys here improve in the bed. I've seen a couple guys who have mentioned you start loosing interest because it's taking so long. I'm just wanting to help keep these guys heads in game.

Posts.Title: Sex and PC

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by PDV I had one side of nerves taken too. In just a few weeks I was getting erections that were kind of like water balloons on Cialis (20mg) but they didn't get any firmer in four months. My doc's assistant recommended I switch to Viagra. I did and...Viva Viagra! Thanks to a tip from Michigan Man 16 on this forum I got a prescription from LUEA Pharmacy in Michigan for 90 tabs of 20 mg generic Viagra (sidenafil) for 55 bucks. I don't know if it was the switch or just that I am five months post op but I am a happy camper. My wife is too. Strong like bull! I have no problem taking what ever to get back in the saddle. I told the wife about the shot...OMG...she was freaking out. Then she ask "could you do that?" I said "HELL yeah!"

Posts.Title: Sex and PC

Posts.Content: I'm sure this is going to sound like bragging ( I am actually!) but last Saturday night "exercises" resulted in very nearly full length firmness. That's something I've not had since the surgery. It was good enough for over one minute of intercourse! I've had it firm enough to go at it, but it was a little on the short side. Seeing how my surgeon only save nerves on one side I'm sure I'm way early for this much success...but the more I think about it the more I think my daily exercises are helping. When I'm showering I do the exercises mention on the PE Gym web site I've mentioned before. I truly believe it's helping me. I'm getting instant reactions from just kissing the wife or playing with her when she is cooking. Not full blown but enough I have to adjust my little man. One of the main things they talk about in these exercises doing is to help improve the blood flow though out the penis...to help "clean" out the tubes where the blood goes... I was doing these before I even knew I had cancer so my penis is used to the activity...which is just like working out in the gym. Over-training is bad...but a couple minutes during every shower could help some of you guys recover faster. I'm one month 8 days post op as of today. Can't wait till I'm one month post op!

Over-training is bad...but a couple minutes during every shower could help some of you guys recover faster. I'm one month 8 days post op as of today. Can't wait till I'm one month post op!

Posts.Title: 38 years old very confused about whats going on

Posts.Content: I'll never forget when we got the word. My PSA was 8 on the first test. To be honest I was going to ignore the test results because it was part of "wellness" program for work...I only took the blood test to save $10 a month on my medical insurance. About a month after the test which I kept secret I dislocated my color bone in the gym. The wife and I went to Dr. office to pickup a referral to see a specialist. While at the Dr. office picking up the referral the receptionist said..."oh here is your other referral!" Well the wife was curious about what was in the envelope and opened it. She insisted I go so I made an appointment. He did the finger thing and found a small lump on the left side and retested the PSA. It came back at 6 so he said because of the lump he wanted to do a biopsy. Came back again and had that done. To be honest neither of us thought to much about. I'm healthier than most horses...look much younger than I really am. Survived a loooong list of accidents that should have killed me when I was a teenager. So I figured it was nothing and we would continue our lives. Well....we go into his office and the look on his face was not good. He made the announcement that I tested positive with prostate cancer! My wife went hysterical, crying uncontrollably with her face buried in the pillow. The Dr. and I continued to talk about it. About the only thing I knew about it was you lost you bedtime pleasures. My wife never would look at the Dr. when he finished talking. He told us to take our time and see his reception before we left. It still a minute or two before she would look at me. She told me she wanted to slap his face for being so cold when he told us. So I went to researching Dr. for the job. The original Dr. had only done 300 robotic surgeries so I found Dr. Brian Miles and he had done thousand of operations, so went with him and been happy that we did! The rest is history!

The older we get the lower our test gets, the more likely you are to get PC. So I think a case could be made that lower...or dropping test causes PC to kick off and start being an issue. It just seems like if it is truce test causes cancer to grow and be more active...young men should be more prone to cancer than older men...

Posts.Content: Family stuff kept us from the planned Friday night adventure, but we got it done Saturday and Sunday nights! It lasted longer than we needed, "it" was settling down after about an hour...not the most romantic thing keeping the mix where it was supposed to be. We lost quite a bit the first night, but it still worked. Trimix did give me a warm kind of feeling at first. Even though it's kept in the frig...my first sensation was warmth. Negative aspect; it was a bit painful getting blood into places it hasn't been in a while. I have experienced it some with Cialis, but not like Trimix! After the "action" was over is when I experienced the hardest erection...when I would go pee to clear the pipe. MAN! That's when it was the most intense. It was bad...like you would die...it was a different kind of pain, more like an irritable thing...

Posts.Content: Be 9 months post-op this week...erections are not good...almost non-existent without any meds. I have run out of my generic Calais, but still have 100mg Viagra...when I ran them together I could get a usable erection with 50mg (1/2 a pill)...I can get a very usable erection that night into the next morning with 100mg Viagra...but it comes and goes...not my style. So I've been using the Trimix Gel (non-needle) down the pee hole. Almost pre-surgery quality erections...plenty hard enough, but penis length is not as long as it used to be...made her happy but kills my pride a little! I'd be happy if just using the pills worked like the Trimix Gel does...

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Maverick91 Howdy, y'all... I thing it's the 'have to' that pi$$e$ me off the most. That, and how this threatens my sex life with my sexy wife. Welcome to the forum! Sorry your here! Your not alone in this part...my wife is 14 years younger than me and my grand daughter from my first marriage is always ask her if she is a super model! I swear that is what she has ask...several times and she is 11yo! She is fine...5' tall Colombian women that doesn't have a single flaw...long black hair and beautiful eyes that are light brown and sometimes turn a little yellow...She is way over my pay grade! LOL BUT any way you've got a great chance to come out of this without problems... Tip number 1: Find the best surgeon you can find. I went from a surgeon who only had done 300 robotic surgeries to one who has done 3,000! At your age there is hope...a lot of hope. You certainly caught it early so that two points on your side!

Posts.Title: new to Prostate Cancer

Posts.Content: Sorry to be welcoming you to our club! But WELCOME! I was diagnosed about 4 months before I had surgery and I had Gleason 7 biopsy. My surgeon agreed with my plan to push it back so the wife and I could go on a romantic vacation while I was still GTG in that area. So we flew to Puerto Rico for a week...a little over two weeks later I went under the knife. My cancer was still contained to the gland and I had negative margins...so it didn't hurt my end results any at all. OMT-if they put you on Cialis use it and enjoy every second of it...even if you don't "need it"...trust me you'll be happy you did!

Posts.Title: Cialis. Who likes it?

Posts.Content: I'm certainly thankful of where I am. To be honest I have not had any "why me?" thoughts. My wife and her family have always expected it and thought I was covering it up, but nope...so far it's not been the case. I know it could be worse...since I've been diagnosed I've learned my X-BIL is dying from some of every kind of cancer you can have. I still see the X at functions to do with our kids and grand kids. She recently missed one waiting for her brother to pass...he is that close to the end. I don't ask my kids about him...not sure if they will tell me or not now that they know I've had cancer too. Lost a couple friends to cancer already too. So I know it's tough... God bless those families going though it!

Posts.Title: do ya ever wonder?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DaDavid Also interesting to me that when I login, it appears there are more people online in the prostate cancer forum than any of the other subforums here. Not sure what that says (and there may be specialized forums for certain forms of C that get more traffic), except maybe guys with PC have more questions, as there appears to be so many treatment options. And it seems to me guys with PC are much less willing to go public than, say, women with breast cancer, so this is a good method to communicate with others in the club. Thoughts on that? Should we propose an official PC color to match Race for Cure's pink? I've noticed the same thing. I have been wondering the same thing...but you might be right. I'm not telling everyone about my PC. I prefer to keep it to a very limited group off people. I like the idea for a color for PC...

Posts.Title: First day without urin pad

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by PDV Cialis and/or generic Viagra....... My wife is a lot younger than me too and it is frustrating but the only thing that heals the nerves is time. Good luck. PDV What was the contact info again for the pharmacy in Canada? I've been digging around looking for and can't find the thread... Delta. Welcome to the other side! I second getting on something like Trimix gel or the Muse gel which ever is available in your area. Because he is going to be pretty much dead for a while. I'm 8 month post-op and I've only had a couple sessions where he was GTG with only Cialis. The cock ring will help a bunch, but this early I'd go with one of the items listed above. He will work with Trimix gel. That's what I've been using. It's not as good as pre-op erections but certainly good enough to get the job done. My wife is also a lot younger than I am so I wanted to get back into action ASAP! I've never used the shots, but would if I need to!

Posts.Title: First day without urin pad

Posts.Content: I've been doing evenings out for dinner on Friday nights without for almost a month...last night the little women started playing around like I might get a little action...whoops! Killed the moment...so we went to sleep...LOL Last Friday evening I forgot to load up when we got home and slept the night without...dry as a bone with just underwear. But it was a good test...still don't trust my ability to control it at night even though I've been dry for a while.
Posts.Signature: DOB-9/14/1959 56 at the time of my surgery PSA- 6/15 8.0 Biopsy- 10/15 16 cores, 8 left 5 cores positive, 8 right zero positive Gleason- 4+3=7 Bone scan-negative-11/2015 Abdominal scan-negative-11/2015 Robotic Prostatectomy- 12/11/15 Nerve Bundles Saved right and most of left Allograph performed during prostatectomy Lymphoids 18 tested all negative Margins-negative Urine-clear of blood by PM 12/12/15 Release from Hospital- 12/13/15 Cath out- 12/17/15 Stopped taking 5mg of Cialis 6 days a week. One day 20mg 2/16 Started back on the same Cialis program 3/16 Started back to work-1/5/2016 9 Months post op 100% dry P/O PSA 1/25/2016 <0.1 P/O PSA 4/04/2016 <0.1 P/O uPSA 4/30/2016 <0.02 Dr. Brian Miles Methodist Hospital Houston Texas. Highly recommend him! ED; Started Trimix Gel 2/20/2016 normal erection after 15 minutes 1/1/2017 started cutting back dosage of Trimix with equally good results! 1/1/2017 50mg is working nearly 100% of the time!

Posts.Title: First day without urin pad

Posts.Content: Well guys and gals everything went great! I reported my last check up from a month ago <.01 and he said prefect, no need to draw any blood then! GREAT! Until he pulled out the box of latex gloves and lube! Then those terrible words "drop'em and assume the position!" I was like "wait...I don't have a prostate any more!" He said I now have to have one every year! What a wonderful surprise for Valentines Day! Got violated at the Dr. office! With the little women there too! She did have get the option to leave, I said I was going to join her...but they wouldn't let me go! No one ever said anything about still having to go through that any more. I thought that was over for ever!

Posts.Title: Went For My Annual Check Up!

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Now What? OK, Davinci surgery a success, catheter out and now taking the time to recover. No more doctor's appointments for 3 months. This evening we made a steak dinner and had wine. We toasted on the continuation of our lives together. No longer worried about widowhood in 5 years, which makes leaking a small price to pay. Took a selfie and sent it to the kids. Nice! Like he said the leaking will go away! This definitely changes the way you look at the future! Enjoy every second of it!

Posts.Title: A Study suggests HT "might" trigger future Alzheimer's

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi'ya Cock, It can differ from case to case, from doctor to doctor, etc. But most surgeons usually wait for 12 weeks before the first post-op PSA test. But others seem to prefer also taking one at the halfway point. So you are probably okay one way or the other. Perhaps with a Gleason 4+3, they just want a sneak preview. But it often can take more than 2 months before all of the PSA works its way out of the system. As usual I didn't type what I wanted to say I guess... I made the appointment myself....just cause I was wanting to know. I do plan to take the results with me on the 8th of February... My question is ...Will my numbers be accurate this soon after surgery? But from you guys are telling me it reasonable to expect them to be accurate. Thanks guy!

Posts.Title: PSA Checked!?!?!?!

Posts.Content: I've seen many guys here refer to getting it checked within 6 weeks...well I don't see the Dr. again until February 8th. So being the patient guy that I am! I got an appointment with my primary care clinic last Saturday to have PSA checked. The Dr who seen me was shocked that I had cancer...very few people can get very close to guessing my age and miss by 10 years most of the time. Any way I forgot to ask him if it was too early to check it? At the time of the test I was 5 weeks one day...too early?

Posts.Title: new psa results

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH For those who could use a laugh, here is something a friend sent to me a few minutes ago: AFTER MY PROSTATE EXAM, THE DOCTOR LEFT. THEN THE NURSE CAME IN. AS SHE SHUT THE DOOR, SHE WHISPERED THE THREE WORDS NO MAN WANTS TO HEAR: "WHO WAS THAT?" Funny to see this...a friend of mine at work just told the one above plus one more.... Last thing you want to hear before DRE Doctor comes into the room and ask you take off your trousers. You ask him, "wear do I put them?" He says... "Right next to mine!"

Posts.Title: UGHY! Why Me!

Posts.Content: Hey BAss, I too am just using pads for safety reasons. I can cough and sneeze without a loosing drop...but if I prop my leg up on a truck bumper to hang out and talk...I get the feeling that I lost a few drops, but have not seen any evidence that really I did. I don't check right away...but if I am it's not much. To be honest my bashful bladder is coming back. I have not done kegels at all. So to answer your question about should you stop...I can't say. But if I think someone is watching me...i'm locked up and can't get much more than a slight dribble going...slept last night for 5 hours without getting up to hit the rest room. Sex...Trimix is saving my life in that area. I was able to get it done one weekend twice without it, but it was not much fun...had to pay a lot of attention to the little guy. Orgasms...they are different...I've had issues with achieving orgasms during normal intercourse before RP, but had one a few weeks ago...that was better than the old days. Just doesn't happen very often.

Posts.Title: UGHY! Why Me!

Posts.Content: Looking back...I can only ID one thing that was odd and out of the ordinary for myself before being diagnosed... I was getting infections very easily around my toe nails...even had one ingrown toenail removed...plus some small infected cuticle on my finger nails...those were minor. Never had them before my surgery and being just under a month post op...of course nothing in the last month. Dooley, Don't forget; Your breathing habits change as you age...sleep apnea...maybe it's that and not so much the PC?!?!?!?!? I have trouble with it once or twice a week...doesn't really cause fatigue but the little women is constantly poking me to make me stop snoring.

Posts.Content: I'm certainly not a chemist but from the things I've found on the internet...Trimix has some of elements from both Cialis and Viagra as well as other "stuff"...I am guessing that is why they call it...TRI=3 Mix...a mixture of three different components...they are just using it a little more directly to where you need it. I get little heart burn/reflux from Viagra so I have to keep Tums handy...one Tums and it's gone...I get a little sometimes after using Trimix Gel too...So I'm pretty sure they are mixing them already

Posts.Title: Headed to Houston......PostOpat MD Anderson

Posts.Content: Yeah...for you guys that are nervous about the needle...which i'm not, but the DR. gave the gel and it works fine...so I've never had to use the needle. From what I've read, the gel lasts better than the TriMix. I've left mine out over night with no ice or refrigeration during a cruise and it still worked perfect. During a trip to Destin Florida a similar thing happened...I had it in a little cooler and the cooler turned over and spilled all the ice out. It ended up getting very warm as it was in the heat of summer...rock hard in about 15 minutes! I have not tried to get my insurance to cover it because it was fairly new when I started it about one year ago. I can now get three sessions out of one syringe out of one. That kind of drops the price to $8.33 a dose...each syringe is $25.00. You get about two hours of guarantied wood (I think your mom could walk in on you and not kill it) so IMO its worth it. Cialis is a bit hit and miss as is Viagra...they work fine to give the little guy some exercise, but for real action...the gel is the BOMB!

Posts.Title: Some good news

Posts.Content: Yeah...for you guys that are nervous about the needle...which i'm not, but the DR. gave the gel and it works fine...so I've never had to use the needle. From what I've read, the gel lasts better than the TriMix. I've left mine out over night with no ice or refrigeration during a cruise and it still worked perfect. During a trip to Destin Florida a similar thing happened...I had it in a little cooler and the cooler turned over and spilled all the ice out. It ended up getting very warm as it was in the heat of summer...rock hard in about 15 minutes! I have not tried to get my insurance to cover it because it was fairly new when I started it about one year ago. I can now get three sessions out of one syringe out of one. That kind of drops the price to $8.33 a dose...each syringe is $25.00. You get about two hours of guarantied wood (I think your mom could walk in on you and not kill it) so IMO its worth it. Cialis is a bit hit and miss as is Viagra...they work fine to give the little guy some exercise, but for real action...the gel is the BOMB!

Posts.Title: PSA angst....

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by JimBow I've had "bashful bladder" all my life as well. In fact, mine has been so bad that I learned to self-catheterize in case of an emergency, such as being away from a private restroom for hours. I've always called it shy bladder, and it's also known as paruresis. Something like 21 million Americans have paruresis, yet it isn't talked about much. Anyhow, I've been wondering how having a prostatectomy might ultimately make it easier to pee, and reduce the shy bladder problem. It's interesting that you brought that up. I'm probably a couple of months away from the surgery, so we'll see. Good luck with your recovery! I still have little problems going if someone walks up behind me...happened today. I took a deep breath and tried to relax and it worked...I was able to go. I think it's helping me control the leakage. I'm really only wearing a pad for just incase this week. Yesterday I didn't have to first drop get loose. I went to the gym this morning and was dry as a bone after.

Posts.Title: Pain Urinating Post Op One Month 4 Days

Posts.Content: Sorry I've been gone so long guy! John, You almost sound like me! Sex is still my number 1 issue. Matter of a fact I just got off the phone with the Pharmacy about my Trimix. Let me say, your number one issue right now is the best Oncologists/Urologist/surgeon you can find! You want the best of the best! I have a very close friend who didn't comfy with me until it was too late. He went from an elevated PSA to a long hospital stay (almost one month) then to full blown cancer in about two months. I found out about his diagnosis just a few days before his surgery. I recall telling my wife I wish he had told me sooner so I could have talked him out of using a rookie surgeon. Last time I talked to him urinary control was not coming back too! 2 things will come out of getting the best of the best...no more cancer and an exceptable recovery. I'm as good as I'm going to get as for going into the bed room...so me and my meds go in and get'ter done! I have great sex and erection with certain meds. I just seen my new Urologist and he wants me to try the injectable Trimix...not big on needles, but have no fear of one...so here we go! Did I mention getting the best Oncologists/Urologist/surgeon you can find? Of course I did! Why because your life depends on it! Your sex life, urinary life, and a long life!

Posts.Title: Complications from My Robotic Surgery - Things you should be aware of

Posts.Content: FYI- surgery 12/11/2015 I know you guys have a ED sticky, but I wanted to throw this out where everyone would at least look at it. I think it can help! I happen to be lucky enough to have suffered from DE (delayed ejaculation). I was normally able to hammer away until I would reach orgasm, but not every time. Even when I was young (I'm talking teenager)...a number of times I would just give up and tell her we could finish later. It did get worse as I got older too. Any way in my quest to try to find a solution to my problem I found web site called PE Gym. They have forums that cover everything from enlarging your penis...exercises for ED...not much help for my problem, but I tried some of their techniques to make my erections harder and some for length as well as girth. And believe it or not I saw improvements in all three areas. I can't say the little women was as happy I was...so I had to stop length and girth exercises because it is uncomfortable for her. She is a little please that I might not be able to get back to my normal size...LOL...that really sucks doesn't it? Any way some of these exercise should be beneficial to all PC survivors. I've been stretching and doing the exercise for girth to help force blood into my penis and have had positive results and I'm not even one month past surgery. I'm on the Cialis 5mg for 6 days and 20mg for one day so I've got that helping me. I've had three occasions where I have got hard enough for penetration...75%ish has been my max. It didn't last long...but I got it in! https://www.pegym.com/ Not sure if the Admin's will freak out over this, but I'm for helping everyone get back in the saddle. And I truly think it can help. Guys look into the threads where they are talking about length and girth exercises...I believe they can help you recover!
Posts.Title: ED-Possible Help For Recovery?!?!?!?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Bravehardon Hi joker, before going through further surgery you may want to consider Trimix. It works with most men who don't have luck with Viagra or Cialis. The needle is so thin and small it's virtually painless. Good Luck Allen Also...Trimix comes in a gel as well if the needle makes you squeamish...I've been using it for some time with great results.

Posts.Title: implant

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Sarg For what it is worth, the surgeon prescribed a vacuum pump after my surgery. I got one and used it faithfully for 6 months. While it may have helped some, it was not really noticeable that I can tell. On my 6 month follow up with the surgeon he said I could quit using it. So maybe it works wonders, according to the ads, but just not for everyone to the extent they say it will. I made one with PVC pipe and an automotive vacuum pump. It worked great if you needed girth, but that was not really the area I was looking to improve. It did help with firmness though. Of course then I had not had my surgery so I'm not sure what would happen now. The NP gave me instruction when she pulled my cath. that the Dr. wants me to start using a pump if I have no responses to the Cialis therapy by Jan. 18th. Luckily I didn't throw it away and still have. I might post up a picture and the details of it to help some of the guys save money if they are interested in having one. Also...I forgot to say you need to run these exercises by your Dr. before you take off doing anything from the site listed above...

Posts.Title: Hoping to hear from the partners

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Now What? This is to the ladies or the male partners among us. Most of what I read here is about the physical healing of the men who underwent the prostatectomy. II absolutely love the support I have found here but I would love to hear about the emotional effects on their partners, either in the forum here or through private messages. . I'm going to make this a two Q&A. First my wife still is not where I am. I can talk openly about having cancer, but she freaks out every time I mention the word. She gets mad that I come to this site because she is afraid I will "get negative thoughts" (her English isn't the best when she gets upset)...I'm white and she is Colombian, so she looks at things a little differently than we do. Originally Posted by Now What? But today for the very first time I broke down when I it hit me that the physical love life we had before the surgery, is now gone.. Even though she is 14 years my junior and should have many more years of interest in this area she is fine if it doesn't come back. Fortunately things are improving steadily in this area...> "R" rated begins...we've been able to get penetration for the last three weekends, it doesn't last long but we can see there is hope every thing will return to normal..."R" rated ends <.... I hope he is on some kind of ED prescription, it is helping me a lot. If nothing else it shows you there is still life down there! Good luck and God bless you two!

Posts.Title: Who do you tell? and why tell them?

Posts.Content: My dad just called and told me a 2nd cousin pasted. He missed what the cause was...just remembered they said cancer. I ask him to find out which cancer because as of this morning no one that I knew of in either side of my family had PC. He called back to confirm Prostate Cancer! So now I have a hereditary connection to where it came from. This is kind of distant but just the same. His mother and my grandfather were brother and sister. To my knowledge we are the only two in the entire family of men to have it! Roughly 18 men sons, grandsons and great-grandson of my grandfather and his siblings. 5 or 6 of them have already passed...only two from cancer...one of those were at my level in the family tree.

Posts.Title: My Hereditary Connection To PC

Posts.Content: Thanks guys! I need to do a detailed sig line like you guys have...my numbers where higher than all three of you...I think...PSA was 8.0....Gleason score 4+3=7...Dr. said it was very aggressive. He took 18 lymph nodes and they all came back negative. It was contained to only the left side as far I as can recall. So I lost some nerves on that side...I have not talked to the Dr. in since I was in the hospital. I see him on Feb 8th. so I plan to get more details then.

I'm hopeful it will came back pretty soon...LOL...before the surgery...I even told the Dr. my number one concern was getting back into the saddle! BUT! This is why I found this site...I want to know real life results...not the percentages my Dr. tends to keep reciting.

Posts.Title: New Memeber- Had My Da Vinci Surgery 12/11/20105

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by gkwhisler I actually was diagnosed in September of 2014 by Biopsy (2 of 10 samples one 5% the other 20% = Gleason 3+3) I had an MRI last April which did not show anything significant. I had my second biopsy yesterday and will get the results in 2 weeks. I am 55, very active (50 marathons and just ran 2 50 mile events). Do I need to have treatment to remove my prostate and if I do how long will I be laid up? Even though I have researched things some I am still very confused about all of it. I am told most people die with PC and not of PC. Welcome! I was born and lived in Virginia until I was 14yo! "IF" you need it removed you will most likely be back in action fairly quickly...three months should have you healed up enough to start training again. I'm a quick healing and have waited to be sure I don't mess up the good Dr. work. Remember ED is the result of the surgery and you don't want to damage any thing that will slow that process down. Personally I'd be nervous as a cat on a hot tin roof doing AS...knowing it is out is a pretty good feeling. BUT...medical advances could save you process of surgery and the ED that comes with it... IMO-radiation doesn't appeal to me...leaving the cancer in there...spooky to me...less options too if it comes back... Any way...way ahead of our selves...good luck on the results!

Posts.Title: Have PC

Posts.Content: Almost one month since my Prostate was removed. I'm 56yo and very sexually active before the surgery. No history of PC in my family...I was the odd man out looks like. My surgeon has done about 3,000 robotic surgeries so feel like I made a good choice, he was not the Dr. who did my biopsy and diagnosis. I moved to the other Dr. because orginal Dr. had only done about 300 procedures and his bed side manors was terrible. The way he told the wife and I nearly killed her! Today is my first day back to work. I'm on my third Maxi-pad for the day...not the best considering yesterday I was dry all day. I'm the most happy that I'm dry all night. The kegal exercise's are not what I thought they were. I've done them for years, but the muscle that controls my bladder is closer to the feeling of my prostate doing the job. So I'm still trying to figure that one out. My Dr. talked me through the exercise I thought I was dead on, but it causes me more leakage than it stops...so this is still a work in progress. Sex of course has been almost non-existent. I got about 75% about a week ago and was able to make penetration, but it didn't last very long. Got it back and again it didn't last very long. I did masturbate to orgasm this morning...but with only about 65%...was not expecting anything to come out, but should have known pee was going to come out...a little messy but felt great! LOL Any way...first post...I'll be checking things out over time!

Posts.Title: About to make the decision

Posts.Content: Hey guys! Been a while since my last post, been busy with a schedule change at work...vacation and things like that. Speaking of vacation...i mentioned we were going on a cruise...we did...had a blast! I did how ever pic up a slight summer cold while on the ship. The wife had some Nightquil so i took a good shot to hopefully kill it before we got to Cozumel so i could enjoy our snorkeling trip. About 2am I thought the ship was sinking! My underwear were WET and so was the bed! I had slept though the urge to go pee...and flooded the bed! I learned a hard lesson for when your sick. Wear something that can handle the flood if you're taking something for a cold! The killer is I had been running around without a pad a few times the week before. I've even started cutting the women's maxi pads in half because I only need the slightest of protection these days (almost 7 months post op). So it really cut into my pride to have wet the bed like that! Now for a little good news! Trimix gel does just fine for a few days without refrigeration! Took enough for a couple nights of action, but was not able to do much more than store it at room temperature. Only thinking about my PC a few times a day now...not constantly for every second like I was a month ago! LOL

Posts.Title: Triple P Gels For ED

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by 7Seas Has anyone developed this after surgery and catheter. Im currently 6 1/2 weeks post surgery and 4 1/2 weeks post catheter and have developed pains in the bladder, frequency of urination and a burning sensation during and after peeing. Just got results of urine culture and it's negative for infection. Antibiotics not working nor the pills that turn urine orange. I had a stinging sensation when I pee'd right where the prostate used to be (where the union was made ) and a spot near the end of the penis that was irritated by the catheter. When I seen the Dr. the last time...6 weeks post op he put me on Vesicare. At times it was bad and other days ok...if I walked a lot it would be the worst, but after two days on Vesicare it was gone. I'm still taking it but doubt I need it. It must be expensive because he gave me a discount card with the prescription...

Posts.Title: Vigorous Exercise Post RP

Posts.Content: Congrats! Yeah 2 out of 3 isn't too shabby...I'd trade a little squirt now and then to have my erections back to pre-op....usable erections are only through modern medicine still. They are close to usable at shower time and playing around with the little women, but nothing to get too excited about. Im still a couple weeks short of 5 months so I guess I should be pleased to have solid erections at all... My little squirts are only from odd positions...can't do the leg up on the bumper while everyone stands around the truck. That causes a tiny squirt every time...can't sit on the steps any more either...lol Any direct contact with "that area" and i get a tiny squirt...gym is no problem, even started drinking a bottle of water during the hour I'm there without any leakage.... Any way...I'm sure you'll be 3 of 3 soon enough! Good luck!

Posts.Title: About to make the decision

Posts.Content: Took my Bio-metric Screening today. Basically...weight, height, blood pressure and blood sample. This was my first indicator that there was problem, the first step to saving my life. I've been pretty care-free all my life...I knew I was bullet proof. Before I turned 18yo I'd had 9 concussions...car accidents, motor cycle accident, fell off a cliff, baseball and football...my great grand father told my parents..."if that kid lives to be 18, it will take a atomic bomb to kill him!" I always though he was right because my workman comp file is about as thick as a good novel! A lot to reflect back on!

Posts.Title: One year ago!

Posts.Content: Wow....the longest year I can remember since I was a kid...waiting on Christmas! Like the title says...today is one day past my surgery! Still have a moment here and there where I leak a tiny bit. But for the most part dry as a bone. Had to go before lunch last Friday and ended up in my truck before I thought about going. Went to lunch and returned...plus took care of some business before I "hit the can". Roughly and hour and half needing to go but didn't! ED still not where I'd like it to be. 50mg of generic Viagra is working pretty good now. The Trimix Gel of course bring me back to my teens! A grade 10 erection for a couple hours! MAN! I like that stuff...wife wants me to stay off that thinking I will return to normal faster without any kind of crutch! I need to make an appointment for this weekend...PSA time you know! Still carrying too much weight and never lost the pubic bulge that accompanied the "bull balls" post surgery. The testicles returned to normal but not pubic area?!?!?!?!? I'm still in the gym a few times a week and got my bench press back up to 160lbs. I really wanted to thank the men and women who post here. You guys have been a true life saver! I will post up my latest PSA when I get the results in! Thanks again!

The only reason I do the Bio-metric Testing is to save $10 a month on health insurance... Short story is...if I wasn't so cheap, cancer would be eating me up right now!

Posts.Title: One year ago!

Posts.Content: I have suffered from DE (delayed ejaculation) long before I ever found out that I had PC. I never thought to much about because the women in my life always looked at me like I was a super hero because it took so long. But my current wife doesn't like the long delay, so I went to the Dr a couple years ago and she prescribed me low dosage of Viagra to help keep me harder hoping that would help and it did, but it wasn't covered under my insurance. So I looked around and found Fildena. Supposed to be same thing...very cheap...I bought the 100mg and cut them into quarters. My Viagra prescription was 25mg... It did help a little with the DE but on long weekends or "honey moon" type vacation (just us) it was nice to have! 25mg would last about two days...so for sport sex is was fun to have around. However it comes out of India. I have bought it two times, both times I got some free stuff, plus the orders were filled to the quantity ordered. The web site is the name dot org. I never sent them any prescriptions just ordered and paid for...got it in less than two week...even got follow up email asking if I was satisfied with the service and product.

Posts.Content: I don't really feel paranoid but I was telling one of the few friends that knows I've had PC, that I must be. His mother is on her last week of Chemo for lung cancer (non-smoker in a non-smoking house). But any way I was telling him I'm waiting on my 4th PSA test since I've had surgery. I'm 8 days short of 5 months post-op, but it feels like it should be twice that long since my surgery. I know I've talked about this before...seems like it was months and months ago, but I'm sure it's not even been two months ago. But I think about having PC nearly every hour of everyday...I'm not depressed or anything like that...not doing the poor little-o'll me thing. But every time I go to the rest room I think about it. EVERY TIME! I'm pretty sure that is one reason it seem like time is clicking along so slowly. Any way...here I sit waiting on another PSA blood test...I think my last one was about two weeks ago! LOL

Posts.Title: Month 122 update

Posts.Content: I don't really feel paranoid but I was telling one of the few friends that knows I've had PC, that I must be. His mother is on her last week of Chemo for lung cancer (non-smoker in a non-smoking house). But any way I was telling him I'm waiting on my 4th PSA test since I've had surgery. I'm 8 days short of 5 months post-op, but it feels like it should be twice that long since my surgery. I know I've talked about this before...seems like it was months and months ago, but I'm sure it's not even been two months ago. But I think about having PC nearly every hour of everyday...I'm not depressed or anything like that...not doing the poor little-o'll me thing. But every time I go to the rest room I think about it. EVERY TIME! I'm pretty sure that is one reason it seem like time is clicking along so slowly. Any way...here I sit waiting on another PSA blood test...I think my last one was about two weeks ago! LOL

Posts.Title: Two years post initial diagnosis

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Jim215 I never cease to be amazed at the number of guys -- most of whom don't see doctors on a regular basis -- who have never heard of the PSA test. To be honest I wasn't going to bother with any follow ups after my PSA 8 in march of last year. I had a dislocated clavicle in late July and went to normal Dr to get referral. When the wife and I went to pick it up. The secretary said "Oh sir, here is your referral to the urologist" . My wife was very curious what that was all about. And she basically saved my life by insisting that I go to the urologist. I would have never followed up on it because I figured it was like having high cholesterol or something like that.

Posts.Title: Family History?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Drbbt . Has anyone had a similar experience? I see my uro in a couple of days, but it's good to know what others have experienced. Thanks! First...congrats on the <0.1 To answer your question...yes everyone! I'm closing in on 12 months post op....peeing is well behind me now...that sounds funny! LOL As for "stream" thats a funny one for me...seem I can only pee for about 45 seconds...if my bladder is really full my stream is like a garden hose...I'm sure they can hear it out in the street in front of my house...if I'm just going because we are walking out the door...stream is like a needle...full power but just a thin stream.

Posts.Title: Urine stream after RP

Posts.Content: Great news on your husband's PSA report! And yes some take a while, I was one of the lucky ones and control is coming back pretty quick. I've been back to work for a while and I just had my Di Vinci in December. Came back to work the first week of January. I supervise fleet maintenance so I walk around a lot...been at one pad a day for about three weeks...but still have moments where for no reason I'll have a weak 30 minutes...then it goes back to near 100% contained...a lot going on down there!

Posts.Title: first psa test after surgery

Posts.Content: I guess I wanted to be like everyone else with the uPSA so I had them do the test. The last thing I want is to have my PSA start moving up without knowing it... It has kind of killed my mood today...didn't say anything to the wife...didn't want to worry her. But she knew i was not my normal self at lunch today.

Posts.Title: Kind of freaking out a little!

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Pratoman This sounds like just normal healing. I dont think that you can extrapolate that because you've recovered from surgery fast in the past you should recover fast from this one. This is total plumbinb rearrangement. I sat on a donut when in the car, and in my recliner, for about a month. With that said, if it really is concerning, then call your Dr. You know your body better than anyone (but maybe not,, after this surgery) Thanks! I agree with the "maybe not, after this surgery" I'm sure I expecting too much for my body. My shoulder rebuild was 2 years ago and they gave me a sheet with the exercises on it that I would take to the rehab/therapist when I left after the surgery. I was already past all movement ranges within two weeks. So when I got to the therapist office he said he couldn't help and to continue with what I had been doing. One month today and I can see this is not going be a quick recovery!

Posts.Title: Almost One Month After Da Vinci Procedure-Pain Question?

Posts.Content: I had some swelling in the testical and pubic bone area after my surgery. My testical are near back to normal, but the pubic bone to the skin area is still about the same. The left side is worse than the right. Plus at times it is painful on the left side. I know it gets worse after I've been in and out of a vehicle several time during a short period of time. If I sit down for a while the pain easies up pretty fast. It's really the only source of pain since I had the surgery...the holes in my stomach were no problem after about 5 days. I could nearly sit up nearly pain free with the exception of this area. How long will this last? I recover from surgery very very quickly so this is concerning me.
